definitions.definition: thrust or spread (things, especially limbs or fingers) out and apart.
examples: her hands were splayed across his broad shoulders

definitions.definition: (especially of limbs or fingers) be thrust or spread out and apart.
examples: his legs splayed out in front of him

definitions.definition: (of a thing) diverge in shape or position; become wider or more separated.
examples: the river splayed out, deepening to become an estuary

definitions.definition: construct (a window, doorway, or aperture) so that it diverges or is wider at one side of the wall than the other.
examples: the walls are pierced by splayed window openings
